channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Winter storm front has entered Texas
item.description: A large winter storm is expected to bring widespread heavy snow, sleet, and freezing rain from the Southern Rockies and Plains into the Mid-South beginning Friday.
item.content:encoded: A large winter storm is expected to bring widespread heavy snow, sleet, and freezing rain from the Southern Rockies and Plains into the Mid-South beginning Friday.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Weber

item.title: Groups worry that limiting paths to citizenship may reduce voter registration efforts
item.description: Each month, thousands of people across the country become U.S. citizens, and that new title comes with a new responsibility: the right to vote.
item.content:encoded: Each month, thousands of people across the country become U.S. citizens, and that new title comes with a new responsibility: the right to vote.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Lucinda Williams channels outrage and joy on 'World's Gone Wrong'
item.description: The legendary Americana songwriter Lucinda Williams releases her new album World's Gone Wrong.
item.content:encoded: The legendary Americana songwriter Lucinda Williams releases her new album World's Gone Wrong.
item.dc:creator: Kira Wakeam

item.title: Images show thousands of newly-identified asteroids. And there's more to come
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to astronomer Sarah Greenstreet about her team's new discovery of the fastest-spinning large asteroid known to man.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to astronomer Sarah Greenstreet about her team's new discovery of the fastest-spinning large asteroid known to man.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: The Eagles break new sales record with their 1976 greatest hits collection
item.description: The band's 1976 greatest hits collection just became the first album ever to earn 4x Diamond certification from the Recording Industry Association of America, or 40 million units sold.
item.content:encoded: The band's 1976 greatest hits collection just became the first album ever to earn 4x Diamond certification from the Recording Industry Association of America, or 40 million units sold.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hodges

item.title: Israel demolishes HQ of U.N. Palestinian refugee agency in East Jerusalem
item.description: UNRWA is accusing Israel of breaking international law for demolishing UN buildings in East Jerusalem. Undeterred, Israeli officials say they want to shut down more UNRWA facilities.
item.content:encoded: UNRWA is accusing Israel of breaking international law for demolishing UN buildings in East Jerusalem. Undeterred, Israeli officials say they want to shut down more UNRWA facilities.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: West Africa's coastal boom: glitzy cities grow fast, but many are left behind
item.description: In the last installment of our correspondent's journey along West Africa's rapidly expanding urban coast, we arrive in Abidjan, Ivory Coast — at the heart of a region where promise and strain collide.
item.content:encoded: In the last installment of our correspondent's journey along West Africa's rapidly expanding urban coast, we arrive in Abidjan, Ivory Coast — at the heart of a region where promise and strain collide.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: In President's Trump's tangled science policies, experts see a unifying thread
item.description: Heading into the second year of Trump 2.0, when it comes to science, some argue Trump has no consistent ideology for decision-making. Others argue the unifying theme is destruction of science itself.
item.content:encoded: Heading into the second year of Trump 2.0, when it comes to science, some argue Trump has no consistent ideology for decision-making. Others argue the unifying theme is destruction of science itself.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Chuck Klosterman still sees football as a net positive (but it's close)
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with cultural critic Chuck Klosterman about his new book, which trains a critical eye on the cultural significance and future of a sport he loves: football.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with cultural critic Chuck Klosterman about his new book, which trains a critical eye on the cultural significance and future of a sport he loves: football.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: In 'Mercy,' an AI justice system determines a detective's fate
item.description: In the thriller Mercy, a detective played by Chris Pratt finds himself accused of murder in a justice system entirely run by artificial intelligence. He has 90 minutes to prove his innocence.
item.content:encoded: In the thriller Mercy, a detective played by Chris Pratt finds himself accused of murder in a justice system entirely run by artificial intelligence. He has 90 minutes to prove his innocence.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello
